<Text: The MG J-type is a sports car that was produced by MG from 1932 to 1934.>
Triplets:<The MG J-type
1:
--------------------
Text: MG J-type:  This 2-door sports car used an updated version of the overhead camshaft, crossflow engine, used in the 1928 Morris Minor and Wolseley 10 and previously fitted in the MG M-type Midget of 1929 to 1932, driving the rear wheels through a four-speed non-synchromesh gearbox.
Triplets:<MG J-type
2:
--------------------
<Text: MG J-type:  The chassis was from the D-Type with suspension by half-elliptic springs and Hartford friction shock absorbers all round with rigid front and rear axles.>
Triplets:<MG J-type
4:
--------------------
<Text: MG J-type:  Most cars were open two-seaters, but a closed salonette version of the J1 was also made, and some chassis were supplied to external coachbuilders.>
Triplets:<MG J-type
5:
--------------------
<Text: MG J-type:  The open cars can be distinguished from the M type by having cut-away tops to the doors.>

Triplets:<MG J-type
